item.title: NFSA RFT 2526/P003: Digital Media Agency
item.description:
The National Film and Sound Archive of Australia (NFSA) invites Tender Responses from suitably qualified and experienced organisations for the provision of a Media Agency with a focus on digital to plan, buy, manage and optimise paid digital campaigns across channels such as search, BVOD, display, audio, social and content partnerships. 

The successful Tenderer (if any) will deliver strategic media plans, ongoing reporting and insights, and work closely with NFSA teams and creative partners to support national brand awareness, audience growth and the launch of a new NFSA website.

item.title: RFT 2025-26 001: Design, Development and Support of the Australian Cultural Fund platform and website
item.description:
Creative Australia is the Australian Government’s principal arts investment and advisory body. The Australian Cultural Fund (ACF) is Creative Australia’s collective giving platform, through which private donors can make donations to preferred registered arts and cultural projects. 

We are currently accepting submissions for the support and upgrade of the ACF platform in two phases:

  • Phase 1: Support the ACF platform for a three-year term and implement immediate security improvements.
  • Phase 2: Deliver a redesign and upgrade of the ACF platform, ideally within the first 12 months.

item.title: SPC-14400: Provision of AI Coding Assistant Tool
item.description:
The Australian Taxation Office (ATO) is planning to incorporate new and current technologies to help support the ATO developer experience, by integrating AI coding assistant tools into the development workflow. 

The ATO is seeking to acquire an AI coding assistant tool to assist the ATO developers with more efficient code development to solve common programming issues which in turn gives developers more time to focus on higher value work, such as test case planning, security controls for application development and maintain current technologies for all developers.

item.title: PROC-9177274: Development of next-generation breeding technologies
item.description:
This investment aims to develop the know-how and technical platforms required to deliver New Breeding Technologies (NBTs) for the Australian Grains Industry.

New breeding technologies including gene editing, targeted mutagenesis, transformation and cisgenics are genome engineering tools with the potential to accelerate genetic gain in plant breeding programs. This in-turn provides opportunities to deliver improved outcomes for Australian grain growers through development of more sustainable, resilient and profitable crops. The Grains Research and Development Corporation (GRDC) has established the Accelerating Genetic Gain Strategic Initiative to drive the implementation of NBTs. This investment is supporting new collaborations between researchers, end-users and commercial entities to improve uptake of pre-breeding research outputs, create new paths-to-market and ensure grower adoption of new genetics.

Through global engagement, several priority areas have been identified and GRDC is now seeking a response to the following open Tender.

 

Theme B: Creating and using genetic diversity

Priority Area B.1: Development of next generation breeding technologies

Summary of the opportunity: A suite of tools including targeted mutagenesis, gene editing, transformation and cisgenics are widely deployed in pre-breeding research. The challenge now, is how to adopt such research-scale technologies in a breeding context so that outcomes benefit Australian growers. Approaches which address both technical challenges and licencing needs by bringing together traditional and non-traditional partners, Australian and International organisations, public and private entities will be required for success. In the first instance, a focus on key trait(s) with a strong value proposition for Australian grain producers will be required to demonstrate the value and path-to-market opportunity for next generation breeding technologies.

Plant SynBio Australia Collaboration Opportunities

Plant SynBio Australia (PSBA) was established through a 'Step Change' investment by the Commonwealth under the National Collaborative Research Infrastructure Strategy (NCRIS), managed by Bioplatforms Australia (BPA). It comprises a national network of facilities that provide plant synthetic biology infrastructure and expertise to academic, government, and industry users. Capabilities such as plant gene editing, transformation, and genetic technology development are offered through fee-for-service, research hotel, and collaborative engagement models. GRDC supports the engagement of tenderers with BPA for access to, and partnerships with, these facilities, enabling researchers and industry to generate knowledge and apply plant synthetic biology to deliver agricultural solutions. For more information, contact Dr Darren Plett at dplett@bioplatforms.com or visit https://bioplatforms.com/synthetic-biology/.

 

Applicants must be able to demonstrate freedom to operate and strict stewardship protocols for the new breeding technologies in target crops; wheat and/or barley. GRDC is seeking a 50:50 co-investment for this contract, please refer to the GRDC budget template (https://grdc.com.au/research/partnering-in-rde-investment/other-resources) for definitions of cash and in-kind contributions. GRDC investment will be up to AUD$5.8M over 4.5yrs.

item.title: GA2025/2458: Palynology for Greater McArthur Basin
item.description: Geoscience Australia (GA), as part of the Birrindudu Deep Dive (BDD) project, is conducting a palynology feasibility study of the Greater McArthur Basin to determine whether a regional biostratigraphic framework can be developed for Proterozoic-aged strata across northern Australia. Quantitative palynological data will be acquired from legacy drillholes.

item.description: Security Guarding Services for the Australian War Memorial

item.title: PROC-9177275: New technologies for targeted recombination in breeding programs
item.description: Emerging technologies enabling targeted recombination in plants can accelerate genetic gain by reducing linkage drag, promoting rare events and generating novel diversity. This AU$4.5M investment supports method development and demonstration in key crops and traits. Proposals should show market potential and encourage collaboration across sectors, including international and Australian partners.

item.title: PROC-9177316: Australian Grains Industry Supply Chain Harmonisation Review
item.description: To provide a review for GRDC of the Australian grains industry supply chain with recommendations for improvement in how information is extended for use in sustainability and traceability credentials. This includes consideration of sustainability credentials, emissions hotspots, and the capacity of growers and industry participants to meet evolving market requirements. The review will be supported by the development of case studies that reflect diverse supply chain configurations and illustrate key challenges and opportunities.

item.title: AZ6592-1: ESTJ2092PH1 (JP2092PH1) Guided Weapons Explosive Ordnance Enterprise Program - DSC Invitation to Register
item.description:
Guided Weapons Explosive Ordnance Enterprise (Program of Works) (PoW) – Design Services Contract (DSC) – Invitation to Register Interest (ITR)

The 2024 National Defence Strategy placed renewed focus on ADFs Guided Weapons and Explosive Ordnance (GWEO) Capability with a requirement to build stocks, strengthen supply chains and manufacture munitions in Australia. 

This Project will support the Government’s direction to increase the Guided Weapons and Explosive Ordnance Capability by providing the facilities and infrastructure required to manage, store, and maintain munitions throughout Australia.

The proposed scope of works is a continuation of the existing ESTJP2093PH1 / JP2092PH1 Guided Weapons Explosive Ordnance Storage Program

item.description: Request for Proposal for the Australian Defence Contracted Health System

item.title: PROC-9177308: Biosecurity preparedness for Wheat Blast - Identifying new genetic solutions and bolstering Australian expertise
item.description: This investment aims to enhance Australian preparedness for wheat blast by identifying new durable genetic solutions through collaboration with international specialists. A postdoctoral scientist will work with global experts to discover new sources of resistance and develop genetic selection tools, which will be disseminated to Australian researchers and breeders. Although primarily affiliated with an Australian organisation, the postdoctoral researcher will undertake a portion of their work overseas in partnership with international collaborators. Additionally, the investment will support a proportion of full-time equivalent (FTE) of the principal supervisor, who will be based within the Australian organisation.
